title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 May 2014 - XWiki
content: has quit 02:51  has quit 02:51  has joined #xwiki 02:51  is now known as 02:52  has quit 02:54  has joined #xwiki 03:19  has joined #xwiki 03:28  good morning guys 03:29  just a question about internal rss feeds, is there anyway to get an rss feed from the site showing up on the rss feed application? I'm trying to display it on the dashboard but get security exceptions which look similar to this: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6690?jql=text%20~%20%221bdd486%22 03:50  has quit 04:04  has joined #xwiki 04:56  hello, question about the activity stream; is there an easy filter so that it won't show pages that were deleted? 06:00  has quit 06:01  has joined #xwiki 07:29  has joined #xwiki 07:41  has quit 07:54  has joined #xwiki 08:17  has joined #xwiki 08:48  has joined #xwiki 08:52  has joined #xwiki 08:59  has joined #xwiki 09:03  has joined #xwiki 09:04  has joined #xwiki 10:33  has joined #xwiki 10:36  has joined #xwiki 10:50  anyone against 6.0 release ? 10:51  if everyone is ok I will start after I updated translations and reviewed release note 10:51  cool, no more blockers? 10:51  no official blockers 11:19  [ANN] starting the maven/git release in 10 minutes, last call for blockers 11:21  has joined #xwiki 11:24  has quit 11:44  has quit 11:46  has joined #xwiki 11:54  hmm panel wizard tests are broken since the upgrade of prototypejs 11:55  [ANN] maven/git release started 11:55  gdelhumeau: there is tons of broken test since the upgrade of prototype 11:57  sdumitriu: ping 12:22  has joined #xwiki 12:39  has quit 13:19  has left #xwiki 13:54  has quit 13:55  has joined #xwiki 14:00  has quit 14:29  [ANN] Maven/git release done 14:44  has joined #xwiki 15:00  has joined #xwiki 15:13  has quit 15:20  has joined #xwiki 15:31  has quit 15:34  has quit 15:51  has joined #xwiki 16:20  has joined #xwiki 17:04  has joined #xwiki 17:51  Guys, I do not achieve to make a choice between LESS and SASS 17:52  I have sent a mail with all arguments I had for both 17:52  you should use LESS 17:52  most answers I've seen are in favor of LESS 17:53  (I don't have an opinion myself) 17:53  is it complex to change later on if need be? is it possible to design a system that allows for multiple implementations? 17:56  has quit 18:03  has joined #xwiki 18:05  I think it is possible to change later 18:05  and we can use both, yes 18:05  ok cool 18:06  gdelhumeau: when we download themese from bootswatch for example do they use LESS or SAAS? 18:06  LESS apparently 18:07  btw gdelhumeau I don't remember seeing your answer to Andreas email 18:07  (Andreas Hahn) 18:07  I was (and still am) interested by your answer 18:08  :) 18:08  hmm yes 18:08  the answer to SAAS/LESS is related IMO 18:08  But I'm affraid it will not be easy to use a bootstrap theme out of the box 18:09  ah, ok that's interesting to understand 18:09  and to explain how to adapt it if it cannot be used as is 18:09  because I agree with Andreas that we need to make this extra easy 18:09  actually I need o buy one of the theme from themeforst to see how they package them 18:09  it's our opportunity to offer lots of themes 18:10  something we've failed to do so far 18:10  and if there is a strandard for such packages 18:13  there are 2 levels I think: themes  and templates. Supporting themes should work OOB. For templates it's more complex since we need to replace static calls with dynamic ones 18:13  is that correct? 18:13  templates == skin for us 18:13  whereas theme == theme 18:13  AFAIU 18:20  This is what we should achieve indeed 18:20  actually, the way I see theme is a set of variables that are used when we compile the style.css with the bootstrap support 18:21  if a reseller sell a custom CSS files, it does not match my set of variables system 18:21  but it should be quite easy to define a new theme and to put it on extensions.org 18:24  but the point of using bootstrap was to standardize on HTML id/class, no? 18:24  so these should be fixed and the CSS should work OOB 18:26  for ex for a label I see bootstrap uses: 18:26  Default 18:26  so "label" and "label-default" are known classes 18:26  and any boostrap theme should know about those and style them 18:26  so that shouldn't require any adaptation 18:31  gdelhumeau: what am I missing? 18:31  I don't think it is abouit standardize our HTML 18:32  to me it is just a good CSS framework 18:32  that provdes good component 18:32  that's not what we discussed when we decided to adopt it 18:32  :) 18:32  and with the help of LESS (or SASS) you can bind our own class to the bootstrap classes 18:32  that's just a bridge and shouldn't change anything 18:32  the point is in supporting bootstrap classes 18:33  either directly or through LESS/SAAS 18:33  so why do you say that a bootstrap CSS theme will not match? 18:34  because a bootsrap css will never have all xwiki specific classes and bugfix we need 18:36  but it shouldn' thave xwiki classes! 18:36  it should have bootstrap classes 18:37  (and xwiki should use the bootstrap classes) 18:37  (directly or with the bridge) 18:37  and when boostrap release a vcersion 4, we rewrite everything? 18:37  (and yes we need to be careful to use existing bootstrap classes instead of having our own) 18:38  then it's either a new skin or we use LESS/SASS to bridge the gap 18:38  then we should rewrite all our applications 18:39  you don't understand what I mean 18:39  it doesn't matter if we have: 18:39  xwiki-layout 18:39  (as a class) 18:39  if it maps to default-layout in bootstrap 18:39  it's a 1 to 1 mapping 18:39  but if we have xwiki-layout and NO mapping then it's an issue 18:40  the problem is if we have complex CSS that don't map to existing bootstrap classes 18:40  but the theme reseller needs to give his overrided bootstrap sources 18:40  if this happens we need to discuss it and possibly simply it 18:40  if not, we cannot map to his work 18:40  and possibly rewrite the part of those apps yet 18:41  if he distributes only the generated CSS files, we are dead 18:41  I don't understand 18:41  ok, 2 sec 18:41  for me CSS != content 18:41  CSS = style 18:41  Let immagine 18:42  I have  a class called xwikicomment 18:42  With Less, I do this thing: .xwikicomment{ .make-xs-column(12); } 18:42  .make-xs-column is a bootstrap mixin so my style.less file is a Mapping file 18:43  make-xs-column is a bootstrap class? 18:43  ok 18:43  it is a mix-in, not a class 18:43  not sure what a mix in is for bootstrap but ok… :) 18:43  it's more like a parametrizable class 18:43  ok 18:43  so if the reseller sell me a bootstrap.css file, I'm dead 18:44  why? 18:44  I still don't understand the problem 18:44  because I don't know how we would interpret make-xs-column(12); 18:44  \*he 18:44  -we+he 18:44  you said this was a bootstrap thing 18:44  but he can have ovverided it 18:45  ok I fail to understand everything but you are saying that bootstrap themes are useless 18:45  because there's no standatrd 18:45  and you can't swap one theme for another 18:45  yes 18:45  so it seems there's no product using bootstrap where you can swtich the thee 18:45  \*theme 18:45  (with a button click) 18:45  ? 18:46  I find this strange 18:46  because for me that was the promise of bootstrap 18:46  I do not know them 18:46  I know a bit Wordpress, and they have their own theme mechanism 18:46  well, as soon as you don't use LESS 18:46  for example when I go to bootstrap theme creator 18:46  I can change the value and I see the result in WYSIWYG for some of them 18:47  you can change your website look just by changing the CSS, yes 18:47  so it works 18:47  and the "standardized" classes will help 18:47  but then we will not have the mapping for old code 18:49  I thought LESS would take care of that 18:49  to convert our classes in bootstrap classes 18:50  hmm 18:50  it takes the content of the bootstrap class and it put it in our own class 18:50  but they also offer mixins: ie a class with a parameter 18:51  and we need the less source for handle them 18:57  has quit 18:59  has quit 19:03  has quit 19:10  has quit 19:12  has joined #xwiki 19:16  has quit 19:21  has quit 19:24  has quit 19:31  has quit 19:34  vmassol: Pong 19:35  sdumitriu: it was about the prototype upgrade which caused a lot of stuff to fail in the build thereafter. I've pinged you at the time but don't know if you had seen my message. Were you able to check? 19:35  (and hi!) 19:35  vmassol: I know, I have to look into it 19:35  I've just been busy, I have a release to make today 19:38  One would expect a point release to just work... 19:39  Especially since it's supposed to improve compatibility with newer browsers, not break it 19:39  yes… you had patched our version of prototype too no? 19:39  Yes 19:39  did you check if that was included in the new version and not needed anymore? 19:40  At least now there's a branch which we can use if we need to upgrade again 19:40  Yes, one of the patches was included 19:40  The others were rejected 20:14  has quit 21:25  has joined #xwiki 21:25  hello there 21:29  i need some help here 21:29  anybody? 21:36  has quit 21:43  has quit 22:22  has joined #xwiki 22:40  has quit 23:20  has joined #xwiki 23:27  has quit 23:31  has quit
